result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Interpreter voucher - John Vaughn.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  John Vaughn appears to interpret, by zoom. The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of operate without owner's consent.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-31-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash with the conditions that he not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license and that he must provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
